snippet: As President Jacob Zuma announced a week of ceremonies, an outpouring of praise came from presidential offices, a prison, and from the streets.
lead_paragraph: As President Jacob Zuma announced a week of ceremonies, an outpouring of praise came from presidential offices, a prison, and from the streets.
abstract: Dignitaries and common citizens from around globe gather in Soweto, South Africa, to pay tribute to Nelson Mandela after Pres Jacob Zuma's announces a week of ceremonies dedicated to his remembrance.

headline.main: Mandela’s Death Stirs Sense of Loss Around the World
headline.sub: Tributes Embrace Legacy of Resistance and Liberation
headline.print_headline: A Moment of Unity as the Tributes Flow From Across the World

byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish reported from Soweto, Lydia Polgreen from Johannesburg and Alan Cowell from London. Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem, Rick Gladstone from New York and Michael D. Shear from Washington.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS KULISH, LYDIA POLGREEN and ALAN COWELL
